Heritage Pointe is a hamlet located in Alberta, Canada within Foothills County. It is located north of Dunbow Road, between Highway 2 (Deerfoot Trail) and Highway 2A (MacLeod Trail), adjacent to the southern boundary of Calgary.
Demographics
}}
In the 2021 Census of Population, the urban population centre of Heritage Pointe, as delineated by Statistics Canada, recorded a population of  living in  of its  total private dwellings, a change of |2075|1}} from its 2016 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of  in 2021.
In the 2016 Census of Population conducted by Statistics Canada, Heritage Pointe recorded a population of 2,075 living in 710 of its 721 total private dwellings, a |2041|1}} change from its 2011 population of 2,041. With a land area of , it had a population density of  in 2016.
